title: For Sale:  Beretta ARX-160 pistol
postcontent:
Hate to see it go, but it has become the gun I leave behind in the safe. So much fun to shoot, monstrous in size, but light weight. Comes with one 30 round magazine. The 20-rounder pictured has a broken feed lip, but you're welcome to have it if you want to try and send it in. Threaded 1/2 x 28 tpi. The flashhider on it is a bit thin, and was mounted on with an o-ring, and a roll pin. I swapped it out for a suppressor, or an actual compensator, and lost the roll pin. If you want the factory flashhider, ACE hardware has all manner or roll pins for $1.00 each, but I would recommend a real comp. Lowest price I could find on gunbroker was $339 (plus $35 ground shipping, transfer $10-50, and background $10), so I'll match that base price. It's had a few hundred rounds through it, mostly suppressed, but it eats everything I have ammowise. Firm on the price. Funding a graduation present for my youngest nephew. If I can't sell it, then it may become the graduation present itself.

This should go without saying, but Oregon residents 21 and older who can legally possess firearms ONLY. CHL preferred, but not required.

This operation system allows for the use of a wide variety of ammunition as it seamlessly adjusts between locked breech and blowback operation, depending on the pressure of the cartridge. It uses a double stack magazine of a new design that holds 30 rounds and fits completely in the grip of the pistol. The trigger is a crisp single action with an over-travel stop. Ruger GP100 Match Champion is Ruger's entry for a competition revolver. It has much better sights, stocks, and trigger work from the factory. Trigger is light-years better than a factory GP100. 

Sights are Novak fiber optic (green). 

I bought this gun with the idea that I would shoot IDPA revolver with it in the summer and kill deer with it in the winter, but I am going to focus on a semi auto competition division and this gun is not getting the love it deserves. Just shot it yesterday at the range to confirm everything and was easily putting a full cylinder into an 8" steel plate at 50 yards. Hammer has been bobbed but replacements are available from Ruger. 

I have Safariland speed loaders and carries available for additional cost. Just grab your preferred GP100 holster and you're ready for IDPA or IPSC.

Trades:

CZ P09
CZ SP01
CZ 75 BD
Other interesting 9mm doublestack handguns.

EDIT 8-7-15
This gun is still available in the described condition, but it's also being rebuilt. I'm modifying and refinishing the original stock. Both stocks will be included in the sale. No changes are being made to the action, and it will drop into either stock with maybe 3 minutes' work. This will give the buyer the option of having it set up as a bench-type rifle, as pictured, or more of a mountain carbine style. I will have photos available of the new stock once completed.

---Back to Original Description---
Based on a Tula Mosin Nagant action, but there's very little of the original gun that wasn't replaced, upgraded, or reworked. Check the photos for a better idea.
I built this to look rustic or distressed, but it's very solid, no junk.

It's chambered in 7.52x54r , and I'm including roughly 100 rounds of 147gr steel core Silver Tip.

The barrel was reprofiled, shortened to 20.25", and threaded 14mm LH, the same as an AK.
The muzzle brake is VERY effective at reducing recoil, and makes a heck of a blast when you fire it. It also has those wicked sharp points for use as a close-in 'deterrent'.

All the metal has been Duracoated in OD Green and Desert Brown, with black accents.

The thumbhole stock was hand carved, epoxy-bedded, then coated in a rubberized sealant that kinda feels similar to truck bed liner material, but is thinner and less 'tacky' to the touch.
Over top of that, is a light coat of a softer, more velvety coating, that was then partially removed to give the weathered look.
You can pretty easily remove the top coat if you prefer the grippier surface.
The butt pad is thicker than most, and really cuts down the felt recoil.
Between the pad and the muzzle break, I'd say the recoil is about twice that of a 5.56, which isn't much!

The scope mount is custom machined from a solid billet of aluminum, and is mounted in a scout (forward) configuration.
Since the photos were taken, the mount was painted black black, to eliminate glare around the viewing area.
I have a cheap red dot type sight on there now, since I was setting this up for close range work, under 75 yards. You could easily mount a long eye relief (LER) or 'scout' scope, if you prefer a magnified optic.

All the internal bolt components and bearing surfaces have been polished and Duracoated. They will wear through to bare metal only where actual contact occurs. This offers the best corrosion protection, while making it look and function its best.
The bolt handle was forged from a single piece of steel into a "spoon"-type profile, threaded, then epoxied into the bolt body. This flat profile makes it easier to open and close the action, especially while keeping the sight picture.

There aren't many truly unique guns available these days, so here's your chance to own a real one of a kind. Since I did the work myself, and fabricated several of the parts, I can say with confidence that there is not another one like this on the planet.

More photos available for serious buyers, not really looking for trades, but I would consider a decent full size (5") 1911 in 45acp. Something like a Rock Island Tactical or similar.

This is a 6-digit serial number, Winchester from August, 1942.  It is NOT a CMP rifle.  It was sent over to Italy, reassembled there and then sent to Denmark until the 60's.  Because it was assembled in Italy, it doesn't have all Winchester parts.  There are a couple of Springfield parts.  The barrel and the stock were made by Beretta; in Italy. title: For Sale:   Springfield Armory  .30-06 Star Gauged Barrel Bolt Action Rifle
postcontent: 30-06 Springfield, "thirty-aught-six" or "thirty-oh-six", 7.62×63mm in Metric and "30 Gov't 06" by Winchester. Bolt Action with Internal Magazine. about 24”  in barrel length.The front sight is a dovetailed set blade. The rear sight is a fully adjustable flip up elevator sight. The sight is a sliding “U” notch that consists of two notches on a single assembly. In the down position one notch is used, in the up position the second notch is used. The elevator is marked from “3 – 27” with hash marks in between. The rear of the base is marked “0 – 0” with hash marks in between for windage.  The two piece stock is hardwood with a pistol grip, metal nose cap with sling loop, metal barrel band with sling loop, metal sling loop under the butt sock and a metal butt plate with a hinged door for a storage compartment. he bore is bright and the rifling is deep. There is no erosion. MW/ME =1.

title: For Sale:  Browning .358 Win BLR - in box, never fired.

There is sort of a .358 Win cult following (of which I am one) - join me.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Palmetto State Armory Ar15 5.56 Nato 16 inch barrel CL 1/7 Twist.

I have a Palmetto State Armory AR15 with 16" Chrome Lined barrel MP/HP Tested 1/7 twist Chambered in 5.56 NATO. Has about 350 rounds fired through it. Comes with quad rail,USGI "silent" Sling, 5 30 round magazines, about 300 rounds of 5.56, a Bushnell TRS-25 optic, Surefire Flashlight with IR and pressure switch and steel flip up rear iron sight, also comes with factory plastic handguard and tool to remove the handguards and a soft case.

Lower: Machined from Aluminum Forgings 7075-T6 Hardcoat Adodizing: MIL-A-8625F, Type III, Class 2 Milspec diameter Receiver Extension M4 Stock Staked M4 Lock Nut Standard Carbine Buffer Un-notched Hammer compatible with 9mm use.

Barrel: 16" Chrome-lined, chrome moly vanadium. Chambered in 5.56 NATO, with a 1/7 twist, M4 barrel extension, and a carbine-length gas system. The M4 profile barrel is high pressure tested and magnetic particle inspected and then phosphate coated. Barrel is finished off with an .750" diameter F-marked front sight base with sling swivel, standard handguards and an A2 flash hider. Barrel is made by FN Manufacturing.

Upper: Forged 7075-T6 A3 AR upper is hard coat anodized black for durability. Featuring M4 feedramp cuts, and T-marks.

Bolt Carrier Group: M16 Full Auto Profile Bolt Carrier Group with Carpenter 158 Steel. Gas key is secured with grade 8 fasteners and staked per mil-spec. Full-auto profile bolt carrier is manganese phosphate treated outside, and chrome lined inside.
